content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: the instructions are clear and concise and the puzzle is not only fun but also is not too easy or too hard to solve

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: fun puzzle

Goal
* Please explain the requirements.

* Please mention the order of output when there are multiple tables to be served.

* Please explain how rows and columns are indexed: do they start from 0 or 1?

Input
* Please rewrite as follows:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[rows]] for the number of rows of tables.
<<Next [[rows]] lines>>: A string [[row]] for a row of tables which consists of characters of either {{F}} or {{H}}. {{H}} marks a table needing food.

Output
* Please change the first "Line 1" to "<<One line for every table to serve>>".

* Please format "X" and "Y" as [[variables]].

* Please change "Line 2" to "<<Last line>>".

* Please format the second "Line 1" in <<bold>>.

Constraints
* Please change "Row number" to "[[rows]]".

* Please change "Column number" to "number of columns".

Cases
* Please reorder the cases such that the two cases of "All tables clear" are a pair. Remember that each pair of test and validator should be similar.

Thanks.

Second Contribution: A Little Late, But Here It Is!

Hey everyone,
I‚Äôm excited to share my second contribution with the community! I had originally planned to release it right after my first work was approved, but exams came in the way. Despite the delay, I‚Äôm glad to present it finally.

Please check it out, and if you spot any areas where I can improve, I‚Äôd really appreciate your feedback. Your responses mean a lot, and they help me grow!

Looking forward to your thoughts!

Thank you for your valuable feedback on my second contribution. I‚Äôve carefully reviewed your suggestions and implemented them. Please let me know if I‚Äôve missed anything or if there‚Äôs any more fine-tuning to be done. I really appreciate your help and insights‚Äîthey've been a big help since my first contribution!

Looking forward to hearing from you again if there's anything else I can improve.

Thanks once more,
5DN1L

You're welcome. Your contribution looks better now. Some more changes:

Goal
* Please change "marked with H" to "marked with {{H}}".

* Please change "column indexing" to "column indexes".

Output
* Please format "X" (in "X = row") and "Y" (in "Y = column") as [[variables]].

Constraints
* Sorry, would you please change the constraints again like this? I think this should be clearer:

1 ‚â§ [[rows]] ‚â§ 10
0 ‚â§ [[X]], [[Y]] ‚â§ 9

Cases
* Please make sure that each possible value of X and each possible value of Y is covered by at least one test and one validator.
  ‚Ä¢ Not covered by any test:
      > X = 8, 9
      > Y = 4, 7, 8, 9

  ‚Ä¢ Not covered by any validator:
      > X = 0, 3, 5, 6, 8, 9
      > Y = 1, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9

Thanks.

"All done, Chief!" XD
I‚Äôve wrapped up the fixes and thought of sneaking in an Easter Egg for some added fun. Since my break‚Äôs over, I‚Äôll need a few more days to get to it. I might reach out for your insights when I work on that‚Äîyour help has been invaluable.

Please take care of me like this üôá

I have no other comments for the time being. üëçüèª

Yes, let me know if you've further edited the contribution, and I'll review it again.

If you have the time, I‚Äôd appreciate it if you could take another look. I‚Äôm open to any further suggestions or feedback you might have. I‚Äôm a bit worried that I might‚Äôve made it too big and coders could find it boring. I‚Äôm constantly thinking about how I could improve this, and I‚Äôm even considering not tying it to my previous contribution and letting it be like it was before. Please let me know if I‚Äôve missed anything.
I do prefer the previous version. The current contribution is like two different things mixed together, and I can't see any linkage ü§î
Don't forget to delete " (or |, <, .)" in Input section. Thanks.

I feel it‚Äôs now complete. I‚Äôm about to submit it for approval, but if you have any final thoughts I‚Äôd be happy to hear them.

Thank you again for your help!

You're welcome.

I don't have any other comments for now.

Thank you too.
